phrases: Let us go out the rear entrance.
Shirou!
What is it, Saber?
I am surprised to see Saber with you.
You...
Archer!
What is with you finally showing up now?
Is not it obvious?
I sensed a threat to my Master and rushed to her side.
But it appears I was too late.
Yes, it is all over!
I will fill you in on everything that happened
while you took your sweet time, so you just stand there and listen!
Looks like I arrived at the worst possible time.
You can say that again!
One Servant was knocked out of the running, and now you decide to show up?
All right, all right.
Next time, I will rush to your side at once.
Well, which Servant was eliminated?
It was the Rider-class Servant that disappeared.
I do not know exactly what happened, but she was probably taken out by Caster.
The coward.
Then she really was all talk.
Archer, Rider died protecting her Master.
You are in no position to call her a coward.
A coward is a coward.
One who calls herself a hero should at least try to take her opponent out with her.
That she was defeated without resistance suggests she was unable to do so.
You insult the manner of her death, and you call yourself a hero?
Hero or not, anyone not suited to fight this battle should disappear early on.
Well said.
In that case, do you wish to fight me, Archer?
I am compelled by Command Seal not to fight you.
If we were to fight now, I would die just like Rider.
Is that in keeping with your code of chivalry, Saber?
Archer, that is enough.
My alliance with Emiya-kun is only until we defeat the Master hiding in the school.
Or what?
Do you want to force me to use another Command Seal on you?
Perhaps.
Saber is so noble and righteous, I got carried away teasing her.
My apologies, Saber.
No, my behavior was immature, as well.
Out of respect for Rin, I shall overlook your words.
Anyway, if we are going to defeat Caster, the first thing we need to do is locate her Master.
Fortunately or not, Caster's Master comes to this school every day.
Rather than spooking them and putting them on guard, we should let them be.
In other words,
after we identify the Master, we attack before they can return to Ryuudou Temple?
Exactly.
But after a big ruckus like this, will not they stop coming to school because it is too risky?
That is unlikely.
I doubt Caster's Master still possesses their free will.
That is her style.
Her very first move was probably to turn her Master into a puppet.
That makes sense.
Anyway, we will continue our investigation of the school.
When we locate Caster's Master, we strike.
Okay, that is a reasonable course of action, but how do we look for them?
That is our homework for next time.
We are all tired.
Let us call it a day.
No, I can still
Hey... Tohsaka!
Cannot you see that Archer is acting strange?
After what happened yesterday, we need to be on the same page.
Okay, I get it!
I will go home.
I will do as you say and go home.
See you tomorrow, then.
Oh, and good work today.
Even if only a little, I was able to see you as a Master.
Let us go, Archer!
When we get home, we will get to the bottom of this screw-up!
Ah, there it is.
The uncharacteristic lack of verbal abuse was troubling me.
Now, look here...
Am I going to have to lay down the law?
You want to sleep in my room?
Of course.
To prevent a repeat of last night's error,
I shall sleep in your room.
Surely you have no objections?
I do!
Big ones!
When it comes down to it,
it is your fault for falling victim to remote hypnosis from such a great distance.
I cannot protect you from Caster's magic,
so it is natural that I at least stay in the same room.
Well, that is a perfectly sound argument.
Look, tonight
All right.
I will have you sleep nearby.
Good.
That is the logical choice for a Master.
But only nearby.
Yeah, as if I can fall asleep just like that, idiot.
It is the sixth day since the war commenced.
You are the first to make their way here.
Then you are withdrawing from the war, boy?
O-Of course I am!
You want me to die?!
Without a Servant, I cannot kill anyone, and I am no longer a Master!
I-I am just an ordinary human.
I am just a victim in all this!
It is unfair to have people coming to kill us, when we cannot do anything!
What?
Do you have a problem with that?
Of course not.
You are the first to withdraw from this war,
and to use this church's services since it was founded.
I will offer you every hospitality.
What?
You are saying I am the only one that is been knocked out?
When my grandfather finds out about this, what will he say?
This is all you people's fault!
You stuck me with that crappy Servant, Rider!
Oh?
Then Rider was of no use to you?
Damn right!
After all I did for her, she went and died like a dog!
Any other Servant would have been way more useful!
Damn it, I did exactly as Grandfather said!
My preparations were perfect!
But those bastards all got in my way!
It was two against one!
I did not stand a chance with those odds!
Yeah, it was not my fault that I lost.
Their Servants were better than mine, that is all!
Always looking down on me with those smug expressions!
Crap, crap, crap, crap, crap!
Crap, crap, crap, crap!
Then you are saying that you still have the resolve to fight?
You are most fortunate.
There happens to be one available Servant.
And what do you think that doctor said to me?
It is rare to see someone so healthy, Fujimura-san,
so perhaps you would care to donate some blood?
Ho ho ho!
I am a patient, too, damn it!
Unbelievable!
Refill!
Anyway, is not it great news that most had nothing worse than anemia?
They did not have to close the school, either.
True.
I am glad that classes will be held as usual, but...
It is a little strange...
Strange how?
Even though it was such a huge mess,
they have no idea what really caused it.
Something about chemicals in an empty classroom on the first floor?
They spent all night scouring the building from top to bottom,
and that is all they have.
But the students in the hospital will be able to go home soon, right?
Yeah.
It will differ from person to person, but most will be able to go home today.
Ah, including Sakura-chan.
Oh, really?
If you have time, you should stop by and see her.
I bet Sakura-chan will be happy to see you.
T-Tohsaka?
There is definitely something suspicious about Issei.
Suspicious?
How so?
Caster's Master.
Caster's made Ryuudou Temple her base, and Issei comes to school from there.
Those things cannot be unrelated.
Come on, it could be a coincidence.
What?
You are sticking up for Issei, Emiya-kun?
No, it is not like that.
Come with me.
Just come on!
Tohsaka?
Look, I get it...
I get what you are trying to say.
I get it, so do not give me that look.
I do not know how to handle it when you sulk on me.
I am not sulking!
Still, I cannot imagine Issei working with Caster to do something so horrible.
Have you forgotten what Archer said yesterday?
His theory that Caster's controlling her Master?
In other words, is not it possible that Issei cannot remember that he is a Master?
That makes sense, I guess.
What?
Do you have another theory?
No.
Good!
I will check him out, then.
Fine!
I will do it!
I will look into him.
Leave Issei to me.
I will find out whether or not he is a Master.
Trust me!
I will not hold back just because Issei's a friend, and I would not lie to you.
All right.
Inform me the instant you know one way or the other.
Got it?
Yeah, I promise.
So, how do you plan to assess him?
Um...
You are not going to do your usual thing and ask, Hey, Issei, are you a Master?
right?
Do not worry!
There are ways to find out if someone is a Master without asking.
Student Council Office
Emiya?
Issei...
Do not ask questions.
Just take off your clothes.
Wh-What did you say?!
Are you mad?
Is this some new form of interrogation?
Are you going to question me?
That is right.
And you will answer!
Look, just strip.
Stop this, fool!
And you call yourself the son of a warrior family?!
Shut up and strip!
What a relief.
It is a real relief!
What is a relief?
What is the meaning of this, making me do that for nothing?!
Oh, right...
Sorry, Issei.
If you think that what you did was wrong,
I insist that you explain your reasons!
Sorry, I cannot give you the details,
but I had to find out something.
Now that I know, we are all good.
Say, Issei...
Have you noticed anything strange at the temple recently?
Strange?
Can you think of anything that is not like it used to be?
Nothing in particular.
The mountain is the picture of tranquility!
Hey, Issei...
School has now ended.
Students are not permitted to remain on campus after school hours.
Please leave immediately.
She went home?
Yes, Tohsaka-san left a while ago.
What the hell?
She said to report to her right away.
Tohsaka?
Hey, Tohsaka, what are you doing here
T-T-Tohsaka, w-w-wai
Be quiet.
If you because a scene, he will spot us.
Who will spot us?
Move.
Go in further.
Boobs...
Tohsaka, your
I said to keep quiet.
There.
In front of Sakura's house.
See that weird guy standing there?
Blond hair...
A foreigner?
Right.
He is been watching the Matou house for a while.
He is coming!
I wonder if he is the guy who was talking to Sakura earlier.
To Sakura?
Yeah, it seemed like he was asking Sakura for directions.
Wh-What are you doing here?!
I could ask you the same thing.
What is with the evil grin?
Nothing!
But that makes sense.
Instead of looking for other Masters,
you are more concerned about the underclassman who always comes over to help you.
I think I understand you a little better now, Emiya-kun.
Do not be stupid.
When I came to report to you about Issei, you would already left.
Anyway, Issei's in the clear.
What?
You already checked him out, Emiya-kun?
I did.
Issei is not a Master.
If you do not believe me, I do not really care.
No, I believe you.
You are not the kind to lie, Emiya-kun.
If you say Issei is innocent, he is innocent.
But how did you find out?
Obviously, I made him take his clothes off.
I took off his top and checked if he had any Command Seals.
Tohsaka, why are you here?
I was worried about Sakura, too.
Well, we are just acquaintances.
According to what Fuji-nee said, she will be discharged today.
She might be at home.
Oh.
Tohsaka?
You are leaving?
There is something I want to ask you.
Fine.
What?
Um, hypothetically...
How do you think someone would feel growing up
if she would been given away for adoption to another family, without any say in the matter?
Emiya-kun?
She would not feel one way or the other.
If her new home is nice, she would not complain,
and if it is not so nice, she would, right?
I see...
I guess you are right.
Why am I even asking such an obvious question?
Let us brainstorm ways to find Caster at school tomorrow.
Sure, will do.
Ow...
It is been a while since you practiced kendo in the old dojo, Shirou.
A while?
Even though he had a fine sparring partner like you, Taiga?
I suppose it has been...
After Dad died, I guess I stopped.
That is right.
When Kiritsugu-san died, Shirou suddenly stopped picking up his bamboo sword.
It made me so sad.
Fuji-nee, do not bring up the past.
Hmph.
Hmm, tales from Shirou's childhood?
Oh, want to hear?
Want to hear?
Yes, I am curious.
All right!
Prepare to be regaled by big sister Taiga!
He was adorable as a child.
He was so trusting of everyone, and he would instantly agree to any request.
But he had a strange stubborn streak.
Once he set his mind to something, he would not budge.
I guess he was the polar opposite of Kiritsugu-san in that regard.
Polar opposite?
Kiritsugu-san was the kind of guy who was accepting of everything.
He thought good and bad were subjective.
A what will be, will be kind of guy.
However, if he saw someone in need, he would try to help.
And Shirou would always try to mimic Kiritsugu-san.
Shirou saw things in black and white more than Kiritsugu-san did.
He would go around and beat up the town bullies, saying, It is wrong to do bad things!
Yep, even back then, Shirou was already a hero of justice.
Why do you want to be a hero of justice?
That is hard to answer...
Because I look up to them, I guess.
You look up to them?
To heroes of justice?
Yeah, I guess.
Why is that?
Why?
Well...
Shirou?
Sorry, I am going to my room.
Why?
What am I afraid of?
Why do you want to be a hero of justice?
My reason for being a hero of justice...
Yeah.
Since you cannot, I will become one for you.
I just wanted to follow in his footsteps.
There is not any such thing in this world.
Let your ideals drag you to your death.
Screw you...
How can you know unless you try?
We attack tonight.
He will not live to see the end of this.
They are nothing more than living sacrifices.
A weapon...
I need a weapon that will let me fight.
Such an irritating boy...
Next time The Fifth Contractor
I believe I shall kill you.
